subject: Travel
title: The Cave of Crystals in Mexico
description: A fast breakdown of The Cave of Crystals in Mexico for builders.

hook.text: Deep under a Mexican mine, a cave holds crystals up to 36 feet long. They're the largest ever found.

buildup.text: Miners discovered the Cave of Crystals in 2000, 980 feet below the Naica mine in Chihuahua.

discovery.text: The selenite crystals grew for 500,000 years in hot, mineral-rich water at a constant 136Â°F.

twist.text: Humans can only survive 10 minutes inside without cooling suits. The heat and humidity are lethal.

climax.text: The mine's pumps keep the cave dry. If pumping stops, water will reclaim it and the crystals will grow again.

punchline.text: The world's most beautiful cave is too hot for humans.

quiz.question: Why can humans only survive briefly in the Cave of Crystals?
